data.quote: I love you the more in that I believe you had liked me for my own sake and for nothing else.
data.author: John Keats

data.quote: But man is not made for defeat. A man can be destroyed but not defeated.
data.author: Ernest Hemingway
data.source: The Old Man and the Sea

data.quote: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
data.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

data.quote: There is nothing permanent except change.
data.author: Heraclitus

data.quote: You cannot shake hands with a clenched fist.
data.author: Indira Gandhi

data.quote: Let us sacrifice our today so that our children can have a better tomorrow.
data.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

data.quote: It is better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both.
data.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

data.quote: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life; and the procedure, the process is its own reward.
data.author: Amelia Earhart

data.quote: Do not mind anything that anyone tells you about anyone else. Judge everyone and everything for yourself.
data.author: Henry James

data.quote: Learning never exhausts the mind.
data.author: Leonardo da Vinci

data.quote: There is no charm equal to tenderness of heart.
data.author: Jane Austen

data.quote: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.
data.author: Edgar Allan Poe

data.quote: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.
data.author: Francis of Assisi
data.source: A prayer of St. Francis of Assisi

data.quote: The only journey is the one within.
data.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

data.quote: Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment.
data.author: Will Rogers

data.quote: Think in the morning. Act in the noon. Eat in the evening. Sleep in the night.
data.author: William Blake
data.source: The Marriage of Heaven and Hell

data.quote: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
data.author: Khalil Gibran

data.quote: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
data.author: Aesop

data.quote: Love cures people - both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it.
data.author: Karl A. Menninger

data.quote: Work like you don't need the money. Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like nobody's watching.
data.author: Mark Twain? Satchel Paige? William Purkey?

data.quote: It is far better to be alone, than to be in bad company.
data.author: George Washington

data.quote: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
data.author: Napoleon Hill

data.quote: Permanence, perseverance and persistence in spite of all obstacles, discouragements, and impossibilities: It is this, that in all things distinguishes the strong soul from the weak.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Independence is happiness.
data.author: Susan B. Anthony

data.quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
data.author: Sun Tzu

data.quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.
data.author: Walt Whitman

data.quote: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
data.author: Sigmund Freud

data.quote: Happiness can exist only in acceptance.
data.author: George Orwell

data.quote: Love has no age, no limit; and no death.
data.author: John Galsworthy

data.quote: You can't blame gravity for falling in love.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson
data.source: Thomas Jefferson to Nathaniel Macon, January 12, 1819

data.quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
data.author: Lao Tzu

data.quote: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
data.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

data.quote: A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another.
data.author: Jesus Christ

data.quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
data.author: Edith Wharton

data.quote: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.
data.author: Samuel Beckett

data.quote: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: Coming together is a beginning; keeping together is progress; working together is success.
data.author: Edward Everett Hale

data.quote: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: Not all those who wander are lost.
data.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

data.quote: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
data.author: Anne Frank
data.source: The Diary of a Young Girl

data.quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
data.author: Thomas A. Edison

data.quote: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.
data.author: Thomas Aquinas

data.quote: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.
data.author: John C. Maxwell

data.quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.
data.author: George Sand

data.quote: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
data.author: Milton Berle

data.quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
data.author: Marcel Proust

data.quote: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
data.author: Margaret Mead

data.quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: The World is my country, all mankind are my brethren, and to do good is my religion.
data.author: Thomas Paine

data.quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation - we are challenged to change ourselves.
data.author: Viktor E. Frankl

data.quote: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.
data.author: Robert H. Schuller

data.quote: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
data.author: Plutarch

data.quote: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: We love life, not because we are used to living but because we are used to loving.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
data.author: Walt Disney

data.quote: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
data.author: Leo Buscaglia

data.quote: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life - think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
data.author: Swami Vivekananda
data.source: Vedanta Philosophy: Lectures by the Swami Vivekananda on Raja Yoga Also Pantanjali's Yoga Aphorisms, with Commentaries, and Glossary of Sa

data.quote: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: You don't choose your family. They are God's gift to you, as you are to them.
data.author: Desmond Tutu

data.quote: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
data.author: Soren Kierkegaard

data.quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
data.author: Socrates

data.quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
data.author: Confucius

data.quote: A kiss is a lovely trick designed by nature to stop speech when words become superfluous.
data.author: Ingrid Bergman

data.quote: For it was not into my ear you whispered, but into my heart. It was not my lips you kissed, but my soul.
data.author: Judy Garland

data.quote: If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you.
data.author: Joan Powers

data.quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'
data.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.quote: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
data.author: Theodore Roosevelt

data.quote: Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold, happiness dwells in the soul.
data.author: Democritus

data.quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
data.author: William Arthur Ward

data.quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: Today you are you! That is truer than true! There is no one alive who is you-er than you!
data.author: Dr. Seuss

data.quote: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
data.author: Nelson Mandela

data.quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
data.author: Norman Vincent Peale

data.quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: Love isn't something you find. Love is something that finds you.
data.author: Loretta Young

data.quote: Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: Do all things with love.
data.author: Og Mandino

data.quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
data.author: Aristotle
data.source: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers

data.quote: Where there is love there is life.
data.author: Mahatma Gandhi

data.quote: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
data.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
data.author: Buddha

data.quote: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!
data.author: Audrey Hepburn

data.quote: Find a place inside where there's joy, and the joy will burn out the pain.
data.author: Joseph Campbell

data.quote: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.
data.author: Maya Angelou

data.quote: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy and the tired.
data.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

data.quote: Gatsby believed in the green light, the orgiastic future that year by year recedes before us. It eluded us then, but that?s no matter?tomorrow we will run faster, stretch out our arms farther?. And one fine morning? So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.
data.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

data.quote: In addition to my other numerous acquaintances, I have one more intimate confidant? My depression is the most faithful mistress I have known ? no wonder, then, that I return the love.
data.author: Soren Kierkegaard

data.quote: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.
data.author: Soren Kierkegaard

data.quote: There are two ways to be fooled. One is to believe what isn't true; the other is to refuse to believe what is true.
data.author: Soren Kierkegaard

data.quote: This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man.
data.author: William Shakespeare
data.comment: in the context of the play "To thine own self be true" is terrible fatherly advice. By not questioning the essential hollowness of his father's advice, Laertes winds up getting everyone killed

data.quote: Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Without music, life would be a mistake.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right.
data.author: Isaac Asimov
